IRPact_modellierung.agents.consumerAgents

Class ConsumerAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • IRPact_modellierung.SimulationEntity
      • IRPact_modellierung.agents.Agent
        • IRPact_modellierung.agents.SpatialAgent
          • IRPact_modellierung.agents.SpatialInformationAgent
            • IRPact_modellierung.agents.consumerAgents.ConsumerAgent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsynchronousConsumerAgent, SynchronousConsumerAgent

    public abstract class ConsumerAgent
extends SpatialInformationAgent
    Actor that adopts technology, communicates and evaluates technology. Refers to many other concepts explained in their rightful place and in the documentation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsumerAgent

        public ConsumerAgent(SimulationContainer simulationContainer,
                     java.util.Set<ConsumerAgentAttribute> attributes,
                     java.util.Set<Preference> preferences,
                     SNConsumerNode correspondingNodeInSN,
                     java.util.Set<Product> adoptedProducts,
                     java.util.Map<ProductAttribute,ProductAttributePerceptionScheme> perceivedProductAttributeValues,
                     java.util.Map<Product,java.lang.Boolean> productAwarenessMap,
                     ConsumerAgentGroup correspondingConsumerAgentGroup,
                     ConsumerAgentAdoptionDecisionProcess decisionProcessEmployed,
                     java.awt.geom.Point2D spatialPosition,
                     java.lang.String agentID)
        Since ConsumerAgents intend to cover numerous, heterogeneous aspects of the simulation, a variety of concepts if found in their attributes. The attributes will be elaborated in the following
        Parameters:
        simulationContainer - The SimulationContainer the ConsumerAgent is to be part of (as a way to reference to other objects in the simulation)
        attributes - ConsumerAgentAttributes the ConsumerAgent is to be initialized with
        preferences - A set of preferences of the actor
        correspondingNodeInSN - SNConsumerNode the actor corresponds to in the social network; used in order to dereference the social environment and position of the actor
        adoptedProducts - Set of (initially) adopted Products of the ConsumerAgent
        perceivedProductAttributeValues - A map to map each ProductAttribute to the perception the actor has of this product attribute
        productAwarenessMap - A map for each product to indicate whether the actor is aware of this product or not
        correspondingConsumerAgentGroup - The ConsumerAgentGroup the actor is part of
        decisionProcessEmployed - The (default) decision process the actor uses in order to make decisions
        spatialPosition - The initial position of the actor in simulation space
        agentID - The ID to be refered to (String)

        public void manipulatePreferenceAbsolute(Value valueConcerned,
                                         double amount)
        Changes the preference of the agent for the given value by an absolute value given by amount
        Parameters:
        valueConcerned - the value corresponding to the preference to be changed
        amount - The amount by which the preference is to be increased/decreased (depending on the sign of amount)

        Parameters:
        valueConcerned - the value corresponding to the preference to be changed
        amount - The fraction by which the preference is to be increased/decreased (depending on the sign of amount)

      • adoptProduct

        public void adoptProduct(Product productToAdopt)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Causes the corresponding actor (this) to adopt the product in question.
        Parameters:
        productToAdopt - product the agent is to adopt
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • removeAdoptedProduct

        public void removeAdoptedProduct(AdoptedProduct adoptedProduct)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the adoptedProduct from the list of adoptedProducts. Should only be called from the process model.
        Parameters:
        adoptedProduct - The product to unadopt
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the adoptedProduct is not adopted by the agent.

      • addPerceivedProductAttributeValue

        public void addPerceivedProductAttributeValue(ProductAttribute productAttributeToChange,
                                              double productAttributeValuePerception,
                                              double timestamp,
                                              double informationWeight)
        processes a perception of a product attribute value through the ProductAttributePerceptionScheme
        Parameters:
        productAttributeToChange - The product attribute the perception is related to
        productAttributeValuePerception - The perception of the repective product attribute value

      • makeAwareOfProduct

        public void makeAwareOfProduct(Product product)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Makes the actor aware of the product in question (changes the product awareness for this product to true
        Parameters:
        product - The product the actor is made aware of
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when product is not part of a ConsumerAgents productAwarenessMap

      • isAwareOfProduct

        public boolean isAwareOfProduct(Product productConcerned)

      • needAlreadySatisfied

        public boolean needAlreadySatisfied(Need need)
        Checks whether the need in question is already satisfied through any product already adopted
        Parameters:
        need - The need to be checked
        Returns:
        boolean whether the need is covered by a product already known to the actor

      • wipeProduct

        public void wipeProduct(Product productToBeRemoved)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Wipes a product from the knowledge of the actor, meaning the actor will - unadopt the product - cease to be aware of the product - for all product attributes lose the perception of these Should only be called when a product is taken out of the simulation
        Parameters:
        productToBeRemoved - the product that is to be wiped
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be throws when productToBeRemoved is not in the consumers productAwarenessMap or contains an attribute not in its perceivedProductAttributeValues

      • forgetProduct

        public void forgetProduct(Product productToBeRemoved)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Being a milder form of disconnecting a product from an agent than wiping, the actor will 'only' forget the product in the sense that he will not adopt it again. Previous adoptions remain untouched (actor will not unadopt the product). Should be used when a product shouldn't be available on the market anymore but still be used by actors
        Parameters:
        productToBeRemoved - product that is forgotten by the actor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be throws when productToBeRemoved is not in the consumers productAwarenessMap or contains an attribute not in its perceivedProductAttributeValues

      • processInformation

        public void processInformation(Information respectiveInformation,
                               double systemTime)
                        throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Method to model how information is processed by the ConsumerAgent. Depending on the type of information (and potentially other factors such as the ConsumerAgentGroup), information are processed according to their properties. Currently, ProductAttributeInformation are processed by being added as perception, with the informationAuthority describing the strength of the perception. Other types of InformationEvents are currently not implemented and will raise an UnsupportedOperationException
        Parameters:
        respectiveInformation - The information to be processed
        systemTime - The time the information is processed at
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Will be thrown when information is of an unimplemented type (currently everything but ProductAttributeInformation)
